title: Impact of Casein Phosphopeptide Amorphous Calcium Phosphate and Proanthocyanidin on Bond Strength of Universal Adhesives to Caries-Affected Dentin in Primary Teeth: An In Vitro Study.
abstract: This study aimed to assess the impact of casein phosphopeptide-amorphous calcium phosphate (CPP-ACP) and proanthocyanidin (PA) on the microshear bond strength (Î¼SBS) of universal adhesives to caries-affected dentin (CAD) in primary teeth.
